jfk.meaning: JFK (proper noun, abbreviation for John F. Kennedy)

un.meaning: a, an, one (masculine singular indefinite article)

sus.meaning: his, her, its, their, your (plural possessive adjective)

su.meaning: his, her, its, their, your (singular possessive adjective)

se.meaning: oneself, himself, herself, itself, themselves, yourselves (reflexive/indirect object pronoun)

a.meaning: to, at, for (preposition, often used as personal 'a')

lo.meaning: the (neuter definite article); it, him (direct object pronoun)

dejan.meaning: they leave, they let, they allow

le.meaning: to him/her/it/them, for him/her/it/them (indirect object pronoun)

tensarse.meaning: to tense up, to become tense

vea.type: verb (3rd person singular present subjunctive / formal imperative)

ajena.meaning: someone else's, foreign, belonging to another (feminine singular)

venía.meaning: s/he/it was coming, I was coming

iba.meaning: s/he/it was going, I was going

guardar.meaning: to keep, to save, to put away

ratito.meaning: a little while, a short time

tocará.meaning: it will play, touch, be one's turn (from 'tocar')

hablaba.meaning: I/he/she was speaking; used to speak

abría.meaning: I/he/she was opening; used to open

ante.meaning: before (in front of); in the presence of

sino.meaning: but, rather (used after a negative clause)

rebotaban.meaning: they bounced, were bouncing (from 'rebotar', to bounce)

temblaba.meaning: it trembled, was trembling (from 'temblar', to tremble)

tuviera.meaning: had (imperfect subjunctive form of 'tener', to have)

encogió.meaning: it shrunk, it cringed (from 'encoger', to shrink)

extendí.meaning: I extended, stretched out (from 'extender', to extend)

acercó.meaning: it approached, came closer (from 'acercar', to approach)

reconociera.meaning: recognized (imperfect subjunctive form of 'reconocer', to recognize)

dejarla.meaning: to leave her/it, to let her/it

entendiera.meaning: understood (imperfect subjunctive form of 'entender', to understand)

cuidar.meaning: to take care of, to care for

comenzaba.meaning: was beginning, used to begin (imperfect tense of 'comenzar', 1st/3rd person singular)
